author: Special Correspondent
text:
The cadres of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Tuesday staged a protest at Muthialpet condemning the ruling Government for failing to deliver free mixers and grinders to the people of the constituency.

Plea to open market

Led by DMK Convener(South) and former Minister S.P.Sivakumar and former Chief Minister R.V.Janakiraman, they also demanded the immediate commissioning of a market at Muthialpet and said even though the construction work had been completed for the market, the authorities did not come forward to open the facility.

Mr. Sivakumar said the ruling government and officials have been inordinately dragging to extend the freebies to the people of constituencies held by Opposition.

“Even as the distribution has been completed in all other constituencies, the people of Muthialpet were left out. After the announcement of protest by DMK, the Chief Minister responded that freebies would be distributed on 15{+t}{+h}. But so far was not given to them,” said Mr.Sivakumar.

He urged the government to explain the reasons for the delay in commissioning of market building.
title: DMK cadre stage protest in Muthialpet
